required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extension Study on Safety of Long-Term Growth Hormone Replacement in Adult Patients With Growth Hormone Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: Extended Clinical Study of LY137998 [Somatropin (Recombinant DNA Origin)] in Adults With Growth Hormone Deficiency

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate long-term safety of growth hormone replacement in adult patients with growth hormone deficiency

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term safety of growth hormone replacement in adult patients with growth hormone deficiency

secondary_outcome.measure: Maintenance of efficacy of growth hormone replacement, measured by lean body mass, which is achieved in the previous trial in adult patients wtih growth hormone deficiency

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having completed the preceding long-term study of growth hormone replacement in adult patients diagnosed with growth hormone deficiency.
- Other pituitary hormone deficiencies being replaced if appropriate
Exclusion Criteria:
- With severe impairments of cardiac, pulmonary, renal or hepatic functions
- With severe psychological disorders
- With malignant cancer
- With hypertension uncontrolled
- With diabetes mellitus
